intro: Gaillonia somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali gaillonia, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
